text: I hate RARE for going Microsoft... They had such incredible gems, such as Conker's Bad Fur Day, and they could've continued to collaborate with Nintendo to create amazing games, for the 3DS and Wii-U. Now they're stuck making stupid Kinect games... At least Nintendo kept the rights to Donkey Kong, otherwise all hell would've broken.
author: Nocteus Lucium

text: @Svesve777 True. I mean online gaming is good in some cases, but just going over to friends' houses and staying up all night duking it out on Killer Instinct or playing games like Super Mario World and DKC was always great. Now days games rarely have multiplayer adventure modes that let you do that.

text: The DKC1 soundtrack is amazing. While DKC2 is epic and sweeping, DKC1 tends to be more ambient, something extremely rare in platformers. I think that it gives the game an unique charm.

author: Alex

text:
Oh my god, I remember this song.... It's just about the only song I remember from this game besides the title music. 

This song is so epic, and shows the darker side of the game, how it wasn't all banana trees and jumping on beavers and crocodile dudes and riding rhinos.
How it was a maze of dark tunnels, where anything could come out and take all of your lives without you realizing...

text: This was one of a few songs I picked out during my recent replay of this game as being something special. The Factory, Coral Capers, and Ice Cave themes (don't know the titles, sorry!) being the others. And the final battle, of course. I fully agree with the comment that the DKC OST was about atmosphere, and yet it also manages to have some very intricate melodies that work outside of the atmosphere of the game.
